Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
BYU-Idaho students share their experience:

"The Nauvoo trip is something that I will never forget and memory that I will hold dear to my heart!  I can't think of anything that I would change."

- Kasey Kisler

"I really enjoyed the heck out of the tour.  Sleeping on the bus was nothing to be desired but it was a worthy sacrifice for everything I got to see and experience.  Carthage Jail was definitely the highlight for me followed by Adam Ondi Ahman and the Far West Temple site."

- Mark Hallacker

"I liked all the sites we got to see and the information we learned about them... from other students and the faculty who were our 'tour guides.'"

- DaNae Peterson

"I loved every part of the tour.  It was so awesome.  I actually feel like we got to do a lot, considering it was only for the weekend.  For me though, I don't think I could pick just one highlight.  First, I loved everything about Nauvoo, especially the historic part where we could walk around to all the different homes and shops.  The variety show at the visitor's center by the service missionaries and the Historic Nauvoo show with the senior missionaries were both so good.  And then of course seeing Carthage Jail was memorable.  I thought the Independence, MO sites where we tour the other church sites were really interesting, but preferred the Nauvoo stuff more."

- Amy Morgan
